roleset.name: to remove surgically, surgically excising part of a tissue

example.name: resect-v: Arg0, Arg1
example.text: The doctor resected the seventh rib on the right side.
example.arg: the seventh rib on the right side.

example.name: resection-n: Arg1
example.text: Transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) is surgery to remove all or part of the prostate gland, to treat an enlarged prostate.

roleset.note: RESECT-V NOTES: Based on data in Clinical Notes corpus (from resect.01-v)
RESECTION-N NOTES: Comparison to excise.01 (from resection.01-n)
It can be hard to decide if you are removing a whole organ or just a part. When in doubt, first look up the procedure. If still in doubt, use arg 1. (from resection.01-n)

roleset.name: able to be removed surgically

example.name: resectable-j: arg1
example.text: The mass around the left ureter appears to be resectable to me .
example.arg: The mass around the left ureter

roleset.note: RESECTABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. Relation to resect.01. (from resectable.01-j)

roleset.name: abdominoperineal resection: a procedure in which the rectum, anus, some of the colon, and other tissue are removed via entry through the abdomen and the perineum

example.name: abrominal_perineal_resection-n
example.text: Rectum and anus, abdominal perineal resection

roleset.note: APR NOTES: Added for THYME-AMR. Based on discussion in July 2021 e-mail thread, THYME annotation question: LARs and APRs. These terms are really more name-like than compositional (they refer to more than the "sum of their parts"), but they refer to events so they get frames instead of being NEs.
